item.title: 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon Magnum
item.description: No Description Currently Available

item.title: 2018 Pinot Noir Special Selection Magnum
item.description: No Description Currently Available
item.summary: This 2018 Special Selection Pinot Noir is the first Special Selection from Bricoleur Vineyards. The wine’s color is rich ruby red and has notes of red currant, lavender, and dark dry cherry. The refined tannins give a lasting and textured pallet with flavors of strawberry and cherry cola followed by a peppercorn finish. A beautiful style of Russian River Valley Pinot Noir that is delicious to drink now and will age gracefully for years to come.

item.title: 2019 Pinot Noir Magnum
item.description: No Description Currently Available
item.summary: 92 Points “Rich and spicy with a bright, flavorful finish.” - James Suckling.

item.title: 2021 Alexander Valley Zinfandel
item.description: No Description Currently Available
item.summary: This expressive Zinfandel opens with an inviting bouquet of ripe blackberries and dark cherries, delivering a burst of fruit on the palate. Notes of subtle baking spices and a touch of vanilla enhance the complexity, creating a harmonious interplay of flavors. The wine’s velvety texture and well-integrated tannins contribute to a smooth and luxurious mouthfeel. The finish is enduring, leaving a lingering impression of the rich fruit and a subtle hint of oak.

item.title: 2021 Kick Ranch Petite Sirah
item.description: No Description Currently Available
item.summary: The 2021 Petite Sirah presents a deep, inky hue that hints at its intense nature. Aromas of blackberry jam and dark plum immediately captivate the senses, followed by subtle notes of vanilla and a touch of oak. On the palate, the wine unfolds with rich flavors of ripe black fruits, accented by hints of cocoa and a trace of black pepper. Robust tannins provide structure, contributing to a velvety and well-rounded mouthfeel. The finish is enduring, leaving a lingering impression of the wine’s powerful elegance.

item.title: 2021 La Rumeur Red Blend
item.description: No Description Currently Available
item.summary:
French for “the rumor” our custom blend celebrates the convivial banter that surrounds each vintage in Sonoma County. Nature bring unforeseen challenges or was she harmonious right up to the last pick? As we trade stories, themes reveal themselves and eventually a story solidifies. Our final blend is the summation of these annual stories, bringing “La Rumeur” to life.
Custom Blend of Zinfandel, Syrah, and Pinot Noir.

item.title: 2021 Pinot Noir
item.description: No Description Currently Available
item.summary: “…it’s drop-dead gorgeous.” - Peg Melnik, Press Democrat

item.title: 2021 Rockpile Zinfandel
item.description: No Description Currently Available
item.summary: The 2021 Rockpile Zinfandel is the first release from Bricoleur Vineyards. The Zinfandel delivers with appealing aromas of blueberry compote, lightly roasted coffee, chocolate and earthy hints of shitake mushroom.

item.title: 2021 Rockpile Zinfandel Magnum
item.description: No Description Currently Available
item.summary: The 2021 Rockpile Zinfandel is the first release from Bricoleur Vineyards. The Zinfandel delivers with appealing aromas of blueberry compote, lightly roasted coffee, chocolate and earthy hints of shitake mushroom.

item.title: 2021 Syrah
item.description: No Description Currently Available
item.summary: Delighting the palate, discover a symphony of Santa Rosa plums, blackberries, and notes of succulent roasted meat. Infused with nuances of green peppercorns, whispers of sweet tobacco, and judiciously placed oak spice, this wine offers a velvety texture that glides into a persistently rich finish. Experience the purity and intensity of the fruit, harmoniously balanced with refreshing acidity and robust tannins, promising a wine of enduring quality that evolves gracefully with time. 96 Points - Wine Enthusiast

item.title: 2023 Rosé Of Grenache
item.description: No Description Currently Available
item.summary: The 2023 Rosé of Grenache continues in its line of elegant rosés. The wine boasts notes of raspberry and peach with an added floral twist of jasmine. On the palate, the wine is perfectly balanced with lovely weight complimented by bright acidity as flavors of juicy watermelon and nectarine wash over in an extended finish.

item.title: 2023 Sauvignon Blanc
item.description: No Description Currently Available

item.title: 2023 Unoaked Chardonnay
item.description: No Description Currently Available
item.summary: The 2023 Unoaked Chardonnay is a lovely expression of our estate-grown Wente and Chardonnay Musqué clones. The wine boasts aromas of lemon blossoms and freshly cut crisp pear. Flavors of ripe honeydew and Sur lie aging bring lovely texture to this deliberate expression of Chardonnay.

item.title: 6th Annual Fall Club Dinner
item.description: Founders and Équipage Club members are invited to celebrate a spectacular ending to the 2024 harvest! We may be in the middle stages of crush, or it may have just finished, but either way, we will salute the newest vintage with free-flowing wine and a delicious farm-to-table dinner. Indulge in delicious wine and food pairings prepared by our culinary team. This will be our 6th Annual Fall Club Dinner and we are extremely excited to celebrate with you all! We want to thank our Founders and Équipage Club members for their continuous support. We look forward to a beautiful dinner and amazing wine! The dinner will take place on Saturday, October 5th, 2024. Spots are first come first serve, so reserve your spot quickly Price: $195 per ticket Only 100 seats available Purchase Tickets Due to the type of event, we can not accommodate infants or children. Also, due to the nature of our facility and experiences, we are unable to accommodate pets. If you require the use of a service animal, please contact us directly at events@bricoleurvineyards.com to make special arrangements.

item.title: Atelier Bricoleur
item.description:
We welcome you to experience our kitchen for yourself with Atelier Bricoleur — an exclusive, multi-course, after-hours wine and dinner experience at our Chef’s table. Growing up, the heartbeat of our home was in the kitchen. From dinner at the table every night to learning the family recipes, our kitchen was always the place to be. That’s why, as a family-owned winery, the Winery Barn’s kitchen was built with an inviting Chef’s table to draw guests in. Executive Chef Thomas Bellec and his culinary team will specially curate and craft a 5-course wine and food pairing showcasing our wines and fresh ingredients sourced sustainably and locally, some of them from our own estate gardens. Important details:
This experience must be on a mutually agreed upon date This experience is available on a mutually agreed-upon date. This 4-hour experience begins at 5:30 pm PST. Reservations for parties of 8 people. We can accommodate most dietary restrictions. Guests must be 21+. Tax not included Club pricing applies

We'd love you to experience a taste of Bricoleur Vineyards on the road, with a curated wine dinner at Charlie Palmer Steak IV NYC. Join us for a multi-course dining experience featuring chef Charlie Palmer paired with Bricoleur wines presented by The Bricoleur Vineyards team.
When: November 13, 2024 @ 6:00 pm Where: Charlie Palmer Steak IV NYC

item.title: Butter Love & Hardwork Chocolate Bar & Zinfandel Gift Set
item.description:
For the second year in a row, we are partnering with chocolatier, Chris Ford of BUTTERLOVE&HARDWORK. Explore our 2021 Rockpile Zinfandel with a delectable chocolate pairing. Embrace the rich, Dark Chocolate Peppermint Bars, to experience the harmonious blend of dark chocolate and cool, invigorating peppermint. This premium chocolate is the perfect accompaniment to the bold, fruity character of our Rockpile Zinfandel, creating a tasting journey that will excite your taste buds and make your wine experience even more exceptional.
Set Includes:
2021 Rockpile Zinfandel Peppermint Dark Chocolate Bar (2 bars per box) Made in USA with American and imported ingredients.
About Butter Love & Hardwork: Based in Los Angeles, BUTTERLOVE&HARDWORK (BLHW) is an experimental house of confections specializing in chocolate and pastry. Helmed by celebrity chef Chris Ford, BLHW is known for its decadent visuals and innovative flavor palettes that redefine the concept of dessert. From his always-sold-out breakable chocolate sculptures, to delicious collaborations with industry leaders of beauty, fashion and entertainment, BLHW creates interactive edible art that is *almost* too beautiful to eat.

item.title: Estate Extra Virgin Olive Oil
item.description:
Bricoleur Vineyards strives to craft the best, extra virgin olive oil in Sonoma County, California, that honors the extra virgin olive oil making traditions of Italy and Spain.
Olive trees are among the oldest cultivated trees in the world, flourishing in and around vineyards for thousands of years. We have planted more than 200 olive trees thus far and craft estate virgin olive oil in the Old World spirit of Italy and Spain. Our grove includes Leccino (leh-CHEE-no), Frantoio (fran-TOY-oh), and Pendolino’s (pen-DOUGH-leen-oh) varieties from Italy as well as Arbequina’s (ar-beh-KEY-nuh) from Spain. The Sonoma County climate is similar to that of the Mediterranean, with warm, sunny days and cool, crisp nights—optimal for growing both grapes and olives. Once the optimal ripeness is achieved—typically after the wine harvest, in November or December—the olives are handpicked into bins. The fruit is then transported to Olivino, a local mill in Hopland. There, the olives are processed in a certified organic facility, cold-pressed within 12 hours of when they were harvested. The oil is never heated or filtered during the milling process. Extra Virgin Olive Oil is the only cooking oil crafted without the use of chemicals and industrial refining. After the oil rests for two months, it is bottled and labeled by hand in small batches. Our Estate Extra Virgin Olive Oil has a deep, golden hue and rich texture, thanks to the full ripeness achieved from a later harvest. Pretty aromas of butter and dried grass lead to a round, buttery palate with notes of dried grass and marcona almonds. The finish is smooth with lingering hints of white pepper.

item.description:
Purchase Tickets
Friday Evening Yoga Class - May - September 2024 5:30 pm- 6:30 pm
What better way to decompress and unwind from a long week than a yoga class overlooking our vines, followed by a glass of bubbles?
Join us in our Estate Pavilion for an all-levels yoga class led by our resident yoga teacher and Concierge Deacon Carpenter.
Space is limited to 26.
Price $25 (includes a glass of bubbles).

item.title: Garden Summer Harvest Class With Farmer Mikey
item.description: Concluding our series for the year, join Estate Garden Manager Mikey in the back garden for a comprehensive exploration of proper harvest techniques, crop care, and the art of pruning and processing various garden vegetables. This season offers a unique opportunity for guests to gain a profound understanding of the challenges nature presents throughout the course of the growing season. Following the insightful session, indulge in bubbles and a light, garden-curated lunch. Cap off the day by taking home a bag of freshly harvested garden vegetables, gathered moments before by your own hands, ensuring a rewarding and hands-on experience. This event is perfect for aspiring gardeners of any skill level, as well as anyone interested in how we run our “estate to plate” food program. Participants should wear close-toed shoes and clothing that can get a little dirty. Price: $75Duration: 2 hours Only 10 tickets available. Club discount applies at checkout. Must be signed in with the email associated with your club account. We are unable to accommodate dietary restrictions due to the nature of this class. RESERVE TICKETS

item.title: Local Love
item.description:
Give the gift of Sonoma County local favorites!Bricoleur Vineyards 2018 Rosé of Grenache - Grenache is known for making wonderful Rosé of class and style. The first thing you notice about the Bricoleur Vineyards Rosé is its beautiful lightly-hued rose petal color. The wine has a supple texture and crisp minerality. There are hints of white peach, strawberry, and light spices on the nose. On the palate, the wine has a savory fullness of light red fruits. The flavorful acidity and freshness it brings makes the wine extra yummy. It is produced from 100% Fountain Grove District appellation Grenache grapes.Roost Candles - Roost candles are made with 100% natural soy wax, quality essential and fragrance oils, and a cotton wick. Clean and slow burning these 12 ounce smooth and creamy soy candles have an 80 hour burn time. All candles are hand poured in small batches in San Diego, CA. About Roost Owner, Therese Gabaldon is Sonoma County native. Born and raised here, she did not strayed far from her home town. First and foremost, she is a wife, mother, daughter and sister. She love sunshine, good food and wine, and time spent with my people. That is where her joy is found. She believes laughing is always better than crying and sometimes that means putting your big girl panties on to find the humor in difficult situations. Therese tries to put that humor and her favorite lived-in feel into Roost, to create a place where everybody can find a little something they love and feel like they can stay a while.
Apothecary Bottle of Matches - Light a pretty spark with this bottle full of classic white matches! This square glass bottle contains 80 safety matches with classic white tips, perfect for lighting candles. A striker strip is conveniently incorporated into a simple, signature label on one side. The jar comes with a water-tight metal lid. Take your matches anywhere, or keep them on your mantle looking pretty! This is a medium-sized glass bottle (3 1/2" tall), and the white-tipped safety matches are 2" long. As always, well-designed and well-crafted. About Studio Portmanteau Thoughtful home goods for special and everyday use, handcrafted in Oregon's Rogue Valley! A passion for the simple things in life - stargazing, beachcombing, gardening, reading, cooking, the great outdoors - plus a fascination with tiny things and an obsession with all things golden led to the idea behind this design studio specializing in matchboxes and more recently delving into a broader range of other thoughtful objects for the home and special occasions. As a lover of all things vintage, Owner Jessica Cunningham sees the matchbox itself as a tiny little piece of a bygone era that still resonates with us today and reminds us to sit down, light a candle, and spend the evening catching up with friends or devouring a good book. Most of her items are hand-pressed with metal dies on a vintage foil stamper that is the mainstay of my studio. Volo Chocolate Bar (2.5oz bar/72 gram) - 73% Deep Dark Chocolate. This is Volo's purest, darkest Chocolate. Its creamy texture has a balanced flavor that is rich, not bitter with notes of dark caramel, fudge + dried cherry. They use Cacao (cocoa beans) from the mountainous, tropical regions of Guatemala, which are carefully roasted to bring out their rich flavors. It is then refined with a pinch of Sea Salt, Organic Cane Juice, and molded into the bar.About Volo Chocolate While living in Mexico and working at a small beach resort at the Southern tip of Baja California as Executive Chefs, Susan & Jeff Mall fell in love with the flavors and soul of Mexican chocolate. They enjoyed many wonderful hours experimenting with the many ways we could bring out the flavors through various techniques and ingredients. It wasn’t long before they created a great “bean to bar” craft chocolate recipe. Once they returned home to Sonoma County they decided to start our chocolate making business with all of the love and passion that fine chocolate deserves. Susan & Jeff produce over 1,200 chocolate bars per week in our production studio here in Windsor using local ingredients whenever possible including: Clover Dairy, Petaluma Hill Dairy, Merchant & Miller Extra Virgin Olive Oil, and Flying Goat Coffee. They also have our printing done in Sonoma County. The cocoa beans we use are sourced from the Lachua and the Polochic Valley regions from farmers’ associations of growers in Guatemala and from another farmers’ association in Haiti.
When you check out be sure to indicate whether you would like this shipped or if you would like to pick up it up at the Vineyard.

item.title: Magnums & Mcf Dinner
item.description:
Indulge in an unforgettable evening celebrating the artistry of French cuisine with Master Chefs of France by Maîtres Cuisiniers de France. Dedicated to preserving and promoting the rich traditions of French culinary arts, this esteemed organization boasts 375 active members spanning 5 continents and 22 countries. Join us as we showcase the culinary talents of Chef Dominique Faury, Chef David Serus, and our Culinary Director Thomas Bellec, each presenting signature dishes that define their illustrious careers. Elevating the experience, we'll exclusively serve MAGNUMS, adding an extra layer of luxury to an already extraordinary evening. Join us for a culinary journey that promises to tantalize your taste buds and transport you to the heart of French gastronomy. Price: $350 Club discount applies at checkout. Menu Monterey Bay Abalone Croquette paired with North Coast Brut Magnum Scallop Carpaccio paired with Rosé of Grenache Magnum Petaluma Duck Ravioli paired with Pinot Noir Magnum Ora King Salmon paired with Special Selection Pinot Noir Magnum Crépinette d'agneau paired with Rockpile Zinfandel Magnum Curnchy Chocolate & Raspberry Tartlet paired with Kick Ranch Cabernet Sauvignon Magnum
PURCHASE TICKETS Due to the nature of this experience, we cannot accommodate any dietary restrictions. Due to the nature of this experience, we are unable to accommodate anyone under the age of 21 as well as pets.

item.summary: “This sparkler can hold its own alongside the best Champagnes, cavas, and sparkling wines on the planet.” — Michele Anna Jordan - The Press Democrat

item.title: Olive Oil Collection
item.description:
Bricoleur Vineyards has strived to craft the best, extra virgin olive oil in Sonoma County, California, that honors the extra virgin olive oil making traditions of Italy and Spain. Bricoleur Vineyards estate olive oil received a Gold at the 2022 Sonoma County Harvest Fair Olive Oil. No better way to enjoy our olive oil than in this locally made dipping plate. This olive oil plate is perfect for dipping bread, and tapas. Set Includes:
1 Bottle of Estate Olive Oil Hayes Ceramic Dipping Plate - Locally made in Windsor, CA Made in Sonoma County by Stephanie Gwilliam (Hayes) Handmade item, no molds or casts used. Size, shape and glaze surfaces may slightly vary
About Stephanie Gwilliam (Hayes) Stephanie is a mother of 2, Preschool Teacher, and Clay Enthusiast based in Sonoma County. She originally found my passion for Wheel Thrown Stoneware Pottery at San Francisco State University. She had always been drawn to clay in an abstract sculptural way, but the idea of art being functional in everyday use became very appealing to her! She then graduated with a Bachelor’s Degree in Fine Arts with an Emphasis in Ceramics in 2012 and have been pursuing utilitarian pottery ever since. Her intension as a potter is to create functional Stoneware that is inclusive to all. Her current aesthetic is a combination of neutrally glazed Speckled Stoneware and bare surface Marbled Stoneware - All thrown on the wheel, high fired in an electric kiln and made completely by me from start to finish. She is inspired by her home garden and tend to create pieces that harmoniously pair with nature from my surrounding environment. She love that my chosen medium as an artist is clay from the earth that is often used to hold what I have grown. A constant theme in her work is ‘Home Thrown & Home Grown!’ Her studio is located just down the street from Bricoleur Vineyards in Windsor, CA.

item.title: Premium Recycled Glass Bedside Carafe & Tumbler Set
item.description:
Bolivian artisans have given discarded cola bottles a second life with our Premium Recycled Glassware. This charming bedside carafe & tumbler set delivers on functionality and style, adding a bit of sparkle to even the most mundane of beverages. Handcrafted from 100% recycled glass, enjoy a truly one-of-a-kind cocktail knowing no two glasses will ever be the same. Vendor: BeHome
Measurements: 20 oz. | 4" dia x 6.5" Made from 100% Recycled Cola Bottles Reclaimed and mouthblown in Bolivia. Ethically crafted in small batches.
CARE INSTRUCTIONS: Dishwasher safe. ORIGIN STORYWe’ve teamed up with a community of Bolivian artisans to give iconic cola bottles a second life as 100% recycled glassware. Due to their uncommon origin, every glass features a rare, pristine aqua tint with its own set of natural uniquities—making each truly one-of-a-kind. In addition to being completely recycled, this storied collection is mouth blown under a Fair Trade program. PLEASE NOTE: Due to the handcrafted nature of our products, appearance may vary slightly. Each of our products is crafted by a pair of hands before making it into yours–making them truly one-of-a-kind.

item.title: Ready To Gift - North Coast Brut Case

This gift set includes the following: 2017 Estate Pinot Noir (1 bottle)
2018 Alexander Valley Zinfandel (1 bottle) Bricoleur Vineyards Wine Bottle Opener (1 bottle opener) Our wine bottle opener is sleek in design and has a stainless steel lever and serrated knife.

item.title: Relay For Life Of Sonoma County
item.description:
More than just a fundraising walk, the American Cancer Society Relay For Life brings together passionate supporters who embody the American Cancer Society vision to end cancer as we know it, for everyone. This volunteer-led experience unites communities to celebrate cancer survivors, remember loved ones lost to cancer, and raise funds to improve the lives of people with cancer and their families through advocacy, research, and patient support to ensure everyone has an opportunity to prevent, detect, treat, and survive cancer. Although each Relay For Life event embraces the uniqueness of the home community, every event does have the same four signature elements: a celebration of cancer survivors, a celebration of caregivers, a luminaria ceremony to honor and remember loved ones, and the opportunity to fight back against cancer. Please donate or join our team today, because together we can end cancer.
JOIN THE FIGHT
item.summary: SIP WITH PURPOSE EVENT

item.title: Riddle Oil X Bricoleur
item.description: This gift set includes the following: "Flying by the Seat of Our Pants" Brut (1 bottle) Riddle Oil Variety Box - Includes 7 x 3ml Roll On Fragrances, 1 x 6ml Body Oil, and 1 x 6ml Spray Lotion About Riddle Oil Riddle Oil is a high-quality luxury fragrance oil and skincare brand located in Venice Beach, CA. They have 7 signature scents, all of them with a different personality; some are great for subtle everyday wear, some are more sensual, some more playful, but all very unique. They also believe that less is more in the fragrance world. Their scents are not overpowering, but rather quietly inviting. Their oils sit close to the body and trail as the person walks or simply creates an aura around the person.

item.title: Sweet Tobacco Wooden Candle - 20 Inch
item.description: Not only does this candle smell good, but it looks beautiful too! Accent your home with simple touches that can bring out the most in your space. The petite carved bowl candle is filled with 100% soy wax. Place it on a coffee table or vanity and dim the lights to create a peaceful ambiance. Each bowl is hand carved and may have variations in color, shape, and size. The hand-carved bowl is reusable after burning. Made in the United States of America

item.title: Yoga At Bricoleur Vineyards
item.description:
RETURNING MAY 2022 Join Bricoleur Vineyards and your favorite yoga instructor for a refreshing and relaxing yoga class overlooking the vineyards!
Fridays - Zen & Zin with Deacon Carpenter 5:00pm - 6:00pm (60 minutes) Wind down your week with this all-level Hatha class focused on accurate alignment and foundational poses, followed by a glass of wine. Price: $15 for Class $10 for wine (paid to Bricoleur Vineyards) To book, please email deacon@deaconcarpenter.com
Saturdays - Vinyasa Core with Nina Jarnum 9:00am - 10:15am (75 minutes) with Nina Jarnum - Vinyasa Core Join Nina for her signature creative, dynamic vinyasa flow. This class is a beautiful mixture of strength, flexibility, and mobility. Price: $15 To book, please email ninajarnumyoga@gmail.com
Sundays - Yin Yoga with Vinita Laroia 9:00 am - 10:30 am (90 Minutes) Enjoy an all-level practice with gentle movement and time to find comfort in every pose. Class includes a short meditation. Price: $15 To book, please email vinitayoga@gmail.com
* If you have any questions about the class formats or schedules please feel free to reach out to Deacon Carpenter of the Yoga Van (www.theyogavan.com) or call him directly at 707-756-6277
